intro: Nesaea pedicellata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and oval, with a hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation.
